paper_abstract: Spatial data occur in several important and diverse applications in P2P systems, for example, P2P virtual cities, GIS, development planning, etc. In this paper, we propose to apply an NA-tree in the Chord system to encode spatial region data in the data key part used in the hash function to data search. That is, we combine the NA-tree with the Chord system to solve the overlapping problem which the P2PR-tree can not deal with. From our simulation results, we show that the number of visited peers in our approach is less than that in the P2PR-tree.
paper_title: Spatial Exact Match Query in P2P Systems Using an NA-Tree Structure
